bug.author: Erlemar
bug.summary: If a path to folder which wasn't created yet is set as filepath in ModelCheckpoint, the folder isn't created.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
This pull request changed the behavior of : <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/pull/2153>#2153</denchmark-link>
Now it looks like this: if os.path.isdir(filepath): self.dirpath, self.filename = filepath, '{epoch}' else: filepath = os.path.realpath(filepath) self.dirpath, self.filename = os.path.split(filepath) os.makedirs(self.dirpath, exist_ok=True) Theoretically, if filepath is a directory, it should make self.dirpath be equal to filepath, and if filepath is a path to file, then self.dirpath is a part of the defined filepath But in fact, if the defined directory wasn't created yet (for example I want separate folder for each run), then os.path.isdir(filepath) is False and filepath is treated like a filename and is splitted. For example, I set saved_models as a filepath. After os.realpath it turns into something like path_to_run_dir/saved_models Then we have this line: self.dirpath, self.filename = os.path.split(filepath) And as a result self.dirpath is equal to path_to_run_dir

comments.comment: Hi! thanks for your contribution!, great first issue!
I think this is the expected behavior. You pass something like path/to/some_random_name which doesn't exist. PL considers some_random_name as the filename.
